hgr::Console Class Reference
[Hierarchical graphics library]

#include <Console.h>

Inheritance diagram for hgr::Console:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Unicode (UTF-8) text rendering console.

Can be used as part of 3D scene or (more commonly) as external component used to draw text.

After constructing the object use addPage() method to add Unicode character page textures to the console. (at least page 0, ISO-LATIN1/ASCII chart, is needed, and it is given in the constructor already)

To draw text using console: console->printf( "Hello, world!" ); console->render( context ); You probably want also to call console->clear() after rendering to clear any buffered text for next frame.

There is two ways to position text: Each item has offset, and then the whole console has position (inherited from Visual). When rendering text both offsets are added together to form the final pixel position on screen.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

hgr::Console::Console (  gr::Context *  context,
gr::Texture *  isolatin1,
int  fontwidth,
int  fontheight,
int  textoffset = 0,
const lang::String &  shadername = "sprite-alpha"
) 
 

Creates empty text list.

Parameters:
context Rendering context.
isolatin1 ISO-Latin1 font texture, 256 (16x16) characters.
fontwidth Width of a single character in the font in pixels.
fontheight Width of a single character in the font in pixels.
textoffset Additional offset (X) in pixels between two consequtive characters in output text.
shadername Name of the text shader to be used.

Member Function Documentation

void hgr::Console::addPage (  gr::Texture *  tex,
int  page
) 
 

Adds character texture page to the console.

Parameters:
tex Character texture of 256 (16x16) characters.
page Page index (=first Unicode code point in the page divided by 256)

Adds a part of an image to this console.

Note that actual rendering is done when render() is called.

void hgr::Console::getShaders (  lang::Array< gr::Shader * > &  shaders  )  [virtual]
 

Returns array of shaders used by this visual.

NOTE: Implementation should not clear the list of returned shaders before adding new ones, since shadesr from multiple Visuals might be collected at the same time.

Implements hgr::Visual.

void hgr::Console::render (  gr::Context *  context  ) 
 

Renders text to the active device.

Uses previous cursor position as start position for the text.

Parameters:
context Rendering context.
